Yggdrasil: That could be a good idea. It will all depend on how the
Tripreds want to act it out also, on their strategy. Can your tell me
what damages your ship suffers and how long it will be until it's
repaired? 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
<cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> "That will not be an issue once Rogue Star is repaired." Devilcat 
> says confidently.  "It may be smaller than a battlecruiser, but it's 
> much faster and its armament and shields are roughly on a par with 
> the Tripred ship.  If we can bring it into play, their firepower 
> advantage will be negated.  And its cloaking ability is quite useful 
> for setting traps."  Devilcat smiles as an idea strikes him.  "That 
> could be used to our advantage here as well.  If the enemy comes 
> expecting the defense capabilities of one starship and they are met 
> with two, it will make a mess of their attack plans.  Too bad it 
> would only work once."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Yggdrasil nods hesitatingly.
> > 
> > Yggdrasil: Establishing a good defense would allow our forces to
> > destroy any attackers, but we would then need to root them out,
> > whoever attacks first. In this case, The maximals could hold the 
> line
> > here while the Rogues go and destroy the remaining attackers at 
> their
> > base. The preds tend to strike with all forces, but I don't know 
> about
> > the Tripreds. Besides, their ship seemed to be quite well defended.
> > That would be very hard.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > "I understand that the Tripreds are much more dangerous," 
> Devilcat 
> > > points out.  "But harsh experience has taught me never to 
> discount an 
> > > opposing force, no matter how weak it may seem.  If we focus all 
> our 
> > > attention on the Tripredacus forces, Hydras is free to strike as 
> he 
> > > chooses.  And I know from doing it myself how devastating that 
> tactic 
> > > is when done properly.  A better plan would be to wait for one or 
> the 
> > > other to make a move, then counter it."
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > Yggdrasil: Alright, but remember I have to talk to you as one 
> > > officer
> > > > to another.
> > > > 
> > > > Yggdrasil looked at Devilcat.
> > > > 
> > > > Yggdrasil: I don't want the Tripreds to take hold here, but I 
> hope 
> > > you
> > > > see why they are the real threat, not the Preds.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> > > wrote:
> > > > > 
> > > > > : : Rodimus Prime : :
> > > > > 
> > > > > Rodimus gets up, looking to the guests on the otherside of 
> his 
> > > desk.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Rodimus Prime: If you'll excuse me, I have to go deal with 
> this 
> > > pod
> > > > problem. If you need anything just contact Kup over the base 
> comm
> > > > system. He'll see that you get quarters or anything else you 
> need.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Rodimus heads out of the base, transforming to car mode. He 
> opens 
> > > a
> > > > comm to Rattrap.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Rodimus Prime: Rattrap, I'm waiting outside the base. Let's 
> go get
> > > > that pod.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Roddy then switches his comm to Nightlight's channel.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Rodimus Prime: Nightlight, honey, would you like to make a pod
> > > > recovery run with me?
> > > > > 
> > > > > : : Kup : :
> > > > > 
> > > > > Kup: Katya, would you like to go present our plan to Rodimus 
> now?
> > > > > 
> > > > >
